item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Uruguay - Upwork
item.summary:
SOUTHWORKS is growing fast and hiring fast. We’re not your average dev firm – so this is a great place to build your anything-but-average dev career.

This is where top developers get the opportunity to:

Be the best – You’ll work on elite three-person Fireteams with other sharp, skilled coders who know how to do top-notch, innovative work in record time.

Grow like crazy – You’ll take the next step in your career and have plenty of opportunities for professional development through weekly feedback sessions.

Take on the challenge – You’ll be tackling new things all the time, have the freedom to self-direct your own work, and get hands-on training with the latest technologies.

Make a difference – You’ll write code for some of the biggest brands in the world, and set a new standard for high-quality, high- profile projects.

SOUTHWORKS aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that we serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.

SOUTHWORKS' developers work on high- profile projects for some of the biggest brands in the world and set a new standard for high-quality. We're looking for developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a developer, you will work on a wide-variety of projects critical to our customers' needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

As a Principal Software Engineer at SOUTHWORKS, you’ll lead software engineering projects for some of the biggest brands in the world and influence teams that design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software. You will plan requirements, identify risks, manage schedules, and communicate clearly with project stakeholders. And, you’ll learn and grow alongside talented teammates who share your attention to detail and appetite for problem-solving.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.
Manage technology programs, defining milestones and success criteria, resource allocation and successful on-time delivery.
Exercise technical judgment in working with multiple cross-functional teams.
Develop tools and processes to improve software engineering productivity.
Communicate schedules, priorities, and status to all levels in the company.
Mentor and train other team members on design techniques, and coding standards.

Minimum qualifications

BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
8 year of experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective C, Python, JavaScript or Go.
Experience working with one or more from the following: Infrastructure, Machine Learning, Mobile Application Development, Embedded Systems, Front End Development, Security and Privacy.
Experience architecting and developing large scale design.
Experience in Program Management on technical cross-functional projects.
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.
Passionate about technology.

Preferred qualifications

Experience managing execution and high quality product delivery.
Ability to exercise technical judgment in solving software engineering challenges.
Ability to be an influential member of a highly integrated team composed of both technical and non-technical members.
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
Fast learner who is comfortable figuring things out with new technology.
Is excited to work with cutting-edge technologies before they are public.

About us

SOUTHWORKS is the remote dev firm people turn to for their most complex, high-profile projects. You get great results without the endless hand-holding and do- overs outsourcing is known for. Too often when you bring in outsourced developers for help, you end up having to help them instead – so you spend all your time babysitting the project.

To make everything right, we bring a unique “own it, bring it, prove it” approach to software development. It’s about thinking beyond the reqs, finding the fastest way to the best outcomes, and always keeping you in the know. And it’s why companies such as Microsoft, Amazon, 7-Eleven, Discovery Networks, and even the Olympic Games count on us.

SOUTHWORKS. Make everything right.

Budget: $5
Posted On: August 21, 2020 21:06 UTC
Category: Full Stack Development
Skills:Amazon Web Services, Website Development, Vue.js, Python, ASP.NET, Large (1000+ employees), Web Application, .NET Framework, Node.js, Java, JavaScript, AngularJS, React, Angular, MongoDB

item.title: NopCommerce 4.3 Complex Plugin Development - Upwork
item.summary:
Technical Tasks

Create one or a series of plugins for NopCommerce 4.3 to support the following functionality.


Product

Add product availability days of week to the Product Administration interface.

- By default, the product is available everyday
- This feature will be used to determine whether the product shows up in Product lists, Filter, Search
- Dynamic tags, described below, will be built from tags of available products

Add this section of product interface to User Rights Administration.


Expensiveness Range

Add to the Administration interface an ability to set expensiveness ranges

$ - set minimum and maximum bounds to determine the low cost
$$ - set minimum and maximum bounds to determine the mid cost
$$$ - set minimum and maximum bounds to determine the high cost

The expensiveness symbol will be used to determine the cost of items for vendors, for example:

$ : 2 – 5
$$ : 5 – 10
$$$ : 10 – 20

Vendor has 10 items, the average cost of item is $7 and the vendor will be assigned $$ expensiveness symbol.


Category (THIS SECTION IS NOT MANDATORY as it MIGHT not be achievable)

Add category special flags to the Category Administration interface.

- By default, the Regular flag is unchecked
- There are two types of catalogs presented on the platform, regular and vendor; vendor catalog has it’s own view and items in the vendor catalog have their own view; whereas lists and items in the regular catalog are displayed normally as without any changes described in this document.

Basically, right now the platform has single views to display product search list, vendor list, vendor product list etc. Introducing the above change will create two types views, one type as described in this document and another as without any modifications.

Must discuss this section, as it might be easier to create a link to a separately built platform for this “Regular” catalog.

Add this section of product interface to User Rights Administration.


Vendor

Add additional fields to vendor.

- Work hours, where user is allowed to purchase from vendor only during these hours.
- Pick up / Delivery availability
- Avatar image
- Coverage delivery radius, only applies when the delivery option is checked


Vendor Page

Vendor has two additional properties:
- Tags
- Favourites group

Tags is a dynamically created field from the tags of currently available products this day. Most common tags are displayed first.

Favourites group is a dynamically created group, it can be created in the background for each vendor at the end of the day. The group is created based on most sales and top rating of the products.


Search Bar

Search bar contains two elements, Location search and Product search.

Location search uses API, i.e.: Google, to perform autocomplete and find an existing address from user entered address string or automatically determined address by the browser. This address will be used to submit the order, in case of delivery this address will be used as a delivery address.

Location of the user MUST be entered prior to getting a list of vendors and using product search element.

Once user enters an address the vendor list is displayed, it uses the following algorithm to fetch appropriate vendors:

1. If vendor has a delivery option only, then algorithm checks the vendor delivery coverage radius to include the user selected location; Simple address to coordinate translation, coordinate subtraction and translation to kilometers should do it here; unless there exists a maps service API to calculate the distance between two addresses.
2. If vendor has a pick up option only, then algorithm checks the vendor coverage radius using the Address Search Limit set in the administration settings of Search Bar.
3. If vendor has both pick up and delivery options set, then use the delivery algorithm, but only if the delivery coverage radius is set, if it is not, then use the pick up algorithm


Notes

Inside the cart products are allowed only from one vendor, user cannot add products from multiple vendors. User must create different orders to purchase from different vendors.

Budget: $380
Posted On: August 22, 2020 05:09 UTC
Category: Ecommerce Development
Skills:nopCommerce, JavaScript, ASP.NET, Microsoft SQL Server, Platform Plugin, CSS, HTML
Country: Canada

item.title: Ecommerce Development - Upwork
item.summary:
I am building an eCommerce site for my brand, Choose Something. Choose Something is a concept inspired by this years election. I wanted to bring people together to help them choose to VOTE by designing t-shirts. The customer will have a choice of two different Choose Something t-shirt designs. $10.00 of each t-shirt will go to either the DNC or the RNC. The customer chooses which one they want their $10.00 to go to.  I am looking for someone to finish building my Ecommerce store on Shopify; code donation buttons, know how to add an automatic email option when customer's subscribe/sign up on my password page, etc. We would be working together. I know basics but need someone who can work faster and is more knowledgable; someone who can do what takes me 10 hours, they can do in 2-3 hrs.

Budget: $200

item.title: nopCommerce Storefront Sales Dashboard plugin for Vendors. - Upwork
item.summary:
Need to develop a Storefront nopCommerce plug-in, for in which the Vendors could see the Dashboard, Orders, Sales, Shipments, Customers, etc, and all the necessary things to manage Orders, Shipments, Products, Customers, etc.

This plugin is basically intended to simply bring the Admin panel items to Store front’s My Account area. The idea is to not give the traditional nopCommerce Admin panel access directly for the Vendors. But all the security things need to be considered while bringing the items to the Storefront.

Milestones:

Split up the task and list the milestones first before starting to work, I will provide the repository for check-in on a daily basis.

Deliverables:

Fully buildable source code of the plugin for 4.2 and 4.30 versions and both binary and dependency DLLs.

All deliverables should be checked into the repository at the end of the project.

Budget: $250
